comments:
When an error occurs building the tree, which can happen a lot these days, the 
error in the log doesn't help out much. Has a CVS error occured or is it the 
users fault?

Log: Wed Jan 23 16:50:58 EST 2002
4 org.eclipse.team.ui 1 Internal error
org.eclipse.team.core.TeamException: Error retrieving remote resource tree
	at 
org.eclipse.team.ccvs.core.CVSTeamProvider.getRemoteSyncTree(CVSTeamProvider.jav
a:605)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.sync.CVSSyncCompareInput.createSyncElements(CV
SSyncCompareInput.java:61)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.ui.sync.SyncCompareInput.prepareInput(SyncCompareInput.java:197
)
	at 
org.eclipse.compare.CompareEditorInput.run(CompareEditorInput.java:288)
	at 
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.jav
a:98)

We were wrapping a CVSException. Now we let the original exception pass 
through. This should give a cleared indication of what went wrong.
